CommonFields.Title: Structure and thermal properties of poly(lactic acid)/cellulose whiskers nanocomposite materials
Author: Petersson, L.
Kvien, I.
Oksman, K.
CommonFields.Location: Department of Engineering Design and Materials, Norwegian University of Science and Technology, Trondheim, Norway

Mixing.Description: PLA was prepared in chloroform by stirring on a hot plate
Microcrystalline Cellulose (MCC) was hydrolyzed in sulfuric acid

ChooseParameter.Other: After repeated centrifugation cycles of 13,000 rpm for 10 mins.; the supernatant was removed and replaced by deionized water and tert-butanol. The tert-butanol content of the solution gradually increased until pure tert-butanol was used.
When supernatant became turbid, the suspensions containing CNWs was dialysed against deionized water. Final suspension pH was 3.5
The suspension containing the CNWs were neutralized with a few drops of NaOH solution

Drying-Evaporation.Description: The suspensions containing CNWs were freeze dried in a Flexi-Dry MP, Kinetics Thermal Systems, USA

Mixing.Description: The suspensions were subjected to three intervals of sonication under the following conditions. In between cycles the suspensions were placed in an ice bath.
The PLA and CNWs were mixed and run in a blender

MoldingInfo.Description: The mixture was casted into Petri dishes greased with silicon and left to evaporate at room temperature

Heating.Description: Films were placed in a vacuum oven to remove chloroform
